\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 9752}

\subsection*{'Crisp' As Though My Brain Likes It}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{JMT}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 &   & oral & Adrafinil & pill / tablet\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 160.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
Several months ago I began using Adrafinil (a `Nootropic') semi-regularily and am impressed with it. Generally tablets are 300mg however I've found that as little a 50mg has significant (albeit subtle) effect.



I find it stimulating in a way similar to l-deprenyl but a bit more intense(IMO).  Concentration, `speed of thought', memory, energy, motivation, and alertness are all significantly increased for about 4-6 hrs.  Mood is mildly elevated.  For me there is a hint of anxiety as well but much less so than with `dirtier' stimulants like caffeine or BZP\ldots   Very `crisp' feeling and as though my brain likes it.



Effects (for me) come on quite `noticably' about 1/2 hour after ingestion and something of a `rush' is felt with very mild but pleasurable `energy waves' detected.  This is with 300-900mg.  



It is worth noting that I consume absolutely no caffeine, nicotine, or any other stimulants and so am likely a good bit more sensitive to Adrafinil's stimulating properties.

\end{document}
